intro: Sphaeralcea subhastata var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often broad and lobed. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals arranged in a globular cluster, typical of the Malvaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
